gw.plugin.rateflow

Interface ICostDataWrapper


  • public interface ICostDataWrapper
    Required interface for a CostData wrapper. CostDataWrapper classes are used primarily by the RateRoutine editor to provide convenient access to certain fields on the CostData instance for the rate routine. On a simple line-of-business that does not support cost overrides, the BaseRate, AdjustedRate, and TermAmount properties will correspond to the StandardBaseRate, StandardAdjRate, and StandardTermAmount properties on the underlying CostData. It is also possible to suppress the visibility of the required properties using the annotation &atsign;VisibleInRateflow(false). This would be an unusual situation--because basis and all of the Standard fields are required to be non-null on a CostData before it generates a Cost--but might make sense if some of those values are set outside the Rate Routine. A line which supports cost overriding, on the other hand, might add logic to the wrapper so that those properties correspond to the Standard properties on an cost with no override, but pick up the values from OverrideBaseRate, OverrideAdjRate and OverrideTermAmount if they have been set. The wrapper is also allowed to implement other properties in addition to those listed here. So long as these properties are public and do not carry a hiding annotation, they will be exposed in the Rate Routine GUI.

    • Method Detail

      • getBasis

        java.math.BigDecimal getBasis()
        Get the amount corresponding to the Basis property of the underlying CostData.
        Returns:
        Basis property on the wrapped CostData instance.

      • setBasis

        void setBasis(java.math.BigDecimal basis)
        Set the basis amount on the wrapped CostData instance.
        Parameters:
        basis - Desired basis amount (money).

      • getBaseRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getBaseRate()
        Get the desired BaseRate from the wrapped CostData. Unless it has been overridden on a line that supports Overrides, this will be the value of StandardBaseRate.
        Returns:
        appropriate BaseRate property

      • setBaseRate

        void setBaseRate(java.math.BigDecimal rate)
        Set the BaseRate property on the wrapped CostData. This will usually be StandardBaseRate, although a wrapper supporting overrides may cause both the StandardBaseRate and the OverrideBaseRate proeprties to be set.
        Parameters:
        rate - the desired value for the base rate

      • getAdjustedRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getAdjustedRate()
        Get the desired AdjustedRate from the wrapped CostData. Unless it has been overridden on a line that supports Overrides, this will be the value of StandardAdjRate.
        Returns:
        appropriate AdjustedRate property

      • setAdjustedRate

        void setAdjustedRate(java.math.BigDecimal rate)
        Set the AdjustedRate property on the wrapped CostData. This will usually be StandardAdjRate, although a wrapper supporting overrides may cause both the StandardAdjRate and the OverrideAdjRate proeprties to be set.
        Parameters:
        rate - the desired value for the adjusted rate

      • getTermAmount

        java.math.BigDecimal getTermAmount()
        Get the desired TermAmount from the wrapped CostData. Unless it has been overridden on a line that supports Overrides, this will be the value of StandardTermAmount
        Returns:
        appropriate TermAmount property

      • setTermAmount

        void setTermAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Set the TermAmount property on the wrapped CostData. This will usually be StandardTermAmount, although a wrapper supporting overrides may cause both the StandardTermAmount and the OverrideTermAmount proeprties to be set.
        Parameters:
        amount - the desired value for the term amount

      • setRounding

        void setRounding(java.lang.Integer level,
                 java.math.RoundingMode mode)
        setRounding is not visible in the RateRoutine edit screen, but is still required. It usually just calls the corresponding function on the wrapped CostData.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to round to, defined as per the specification in BigDecimal.setScale(level, mode)
        mode - the rounding mode to use, as defined per the specification in BigDecimal.setScale(level, mode)
